Our evening drinks at the bar were expensive - about $9 each, but we got generous pours and there were cheaper options available. I'll stay again for the location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, good value for comfort if you can't afford downtown San Diego, on trolley stop”
Reviews.Author: gig-rowing-girl
Reviews.Content: The "nice" downtown San Diego hotels can be very pricey ($300 and up). This is a good alternative in the $150-$190 range, and is on a trolley/train stop, so you don't absolutely require a car. You can walk to a movie theater in 2 minutes, and grocery stores are a 5-10 minute walk. This hotel has a very good fitness facility. Many "business" hotels have small fitness rooms with 2-3 pieces of equipment with one piece often broken. This facility is large with free weights, weight machines and at least 10 cardio-theater machines. There is also an indoor pool, outdoor pool, and outdoor hottub. My stay was for two weeks, and I was very happy to find that the hotel had a single washer and dryer ($1.50 each). I generally choose a king-bed room because I find they have more open floor space, and that seemed to be the case here. My king room was large, with a comfortable desk, hotel-issue loveseat, dresser, etc. As a Hilton gold member, I was able to use the Hilton Honors lounge, but was not that impressed. The breakfast was simple and adequate, but you're not really sitting at tables and chairs, but club-type chairs. However, they have a selection of newspapers. The evening reception is also average, and there is a charge for beer and wine. The lobby bar/restaurant, and breakfast restaurant are better than average, perfectly pleasant. One drawback is the for-fee internet, which is more than $13/day. What is the point of that? It's not the fastest internet anyway. If you must, you can use the internet in the business center. My advice is to ask for a room that faces the trolley, which is slightly more free of freeway noise. Rooms with pool view seem to be regarded as premium rooms, but they are not worth it, facing the freeways also and the constant din of that noise. With door/window closed, it is not very noticeable.

Reviews.Title: “PASS on this one”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCanucks_20
Reviews.Content: From Website "Enjoy the luxurious decor of these oversized rooms.". Yeah right. Rooms are a good size, but are tired and dated. Decor completely plain and rooms smell. NOTHING luxurious about the decor. For $200 a night for a low end room, your money would be well spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, older Doubletree centrally located in Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: Mohsman
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here annually several times for a professional conference. This time I stayed on the Club Floor in a one-bedroom suite. The hotel gets a little more "tired" each time. The suite was large with nice furniture and the bathroom was clean and large and the bed very comfortable. However, the bed it smelled strongly of mildew which I corrected with some purchased Febreze. I was disappointed that the room had no refrigerator, corrected when the hotel delivered one for a $30.00 fee. The Club had decent but not exceptional breakfast food and the selection of appetizers and alcoholic beverages was below the norm for similar hotels. More disappointing was that the club is closed Friday evening and Saturday and Sunday. They do provide vouchers for one appetizer in the downstairs bar each of those nights and a continental breakfast each morning, which I admit is a reasonable alternative. But if you like to grab some items, eat casually without waiter service (which I do) and take food back to your room, this is not possible. The valet parking was also quite below acceptable standards. They do have a valet parking stand at the entrance. However, the valet doubles as the bellman and never once in 9 chances came out, even when he could see a car arrive from his bell stand. Each time we had to bring in our keys and several times there was no one to take them. We didn't eat at the restaurants, but the bar service was slow but decent. The quality of the food average at best. It did have a very nice pool area and exercise room. All in all the place needs a makeover, better service and better club service.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at Best”
Reviews.Author: Picey
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel started when I called two days in advance to notify them that I would be arriving a day later than planned. I was informed I would be charged for the day anyway since it was within 48 hours of arrival. (I called at about 7 p.m.). When I explained that I didn't plan on arriving until late (and therefore was within 48 hours of arrival, I was told (not so politely) that their policy was to cancel by 4 p.m. This was written nowhere. In any case, as a Hilton Diamond member, the Diamond Desk intervened and had the charge cancelled. Upon arriving, I realized my mistake in choosing this hotel which sits immediately adjacent to a shopping mall at the intersection of multiple busy highways. My mistake for not researching further. Although we like to sleep with the windows open, that was not an option at this hotel because the noise was intolerable. Whatever investment they've made to allow them to call this hotel "chic" was obviously in the lobby. The room we had (could they ALL be this bad?) was small and the bathroom was below Motel 6 quality with VERY low ceiling and chipped paint throughout. The "old school" small TV was also worse than most mediocre hotels have nowadays. As a Diamond member I asked for a room upgrade and I was assured that I was given a "very nice room." One can only assume (hope?) that the desk clerk was lying because if this was one of their "very nice" rooms, I can't imagine what the others are like. I suppose if you like "convenience" as some other reviewers have noted, this might fit the bill....depending on if you like the convenience of being by an "anywhere in America" shopping mall. But San Diego is a relatively small city and easy to get around.....what extra convenience is there to be right on TWO interstates that makes this worthwhile? Food in the bar was also mediocre. Breakfast buffet in the lobby restaurant was pretty good. My 12 year old son did think the pool was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MCAAA
Reviews.Content: Great front desk staff Ellen- very peasant, made us feel welcome. Location was ideal. We will definitely recommend and stay in this hotel again. Hilton Honors member is always an advantage.

Reviews.Title: “it is lovely”
Reviews.Author: shavondajourney
Reviews.Content: i loved that hotel. I would recommend it to all my friends, they were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly comfortable bed and sophisticated looking room with a view of a very tranquil city with a green backdrop.”
Reviews.Author: jetsfly
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay only for a weekend but it was amazing and probably the best sleep I have every had. The room was very nice and the color scheme and furniture created a very tranquil and sophisticated vibe. Furthermore, the morning after there was a great all you can eat breakfast with the low package deal I received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but outside noise filters in”
Reviews.Author: bit-by-travel-bugg
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice. On the plus side, it's very nice on the inside. Up to date in the lobby area and the rooms. Both an indoor and outdoor pool. Very friendly staff (front desk, bar and restaurant). My only concern is the noise. i've stayed here twice. Once I faced the light rail / trolley, and I heard it ring its bell on and off the whole time. Most recently I faced the 163 freeway, and even though I was on the 10th floor, there was a lot of road noise. It didn't affect my sleep but when I was awake at the desk, I thought it was quit loud.

Reviews.Title: “Our Annual End of School Mini Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ym8314
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before and have always enjoyed it. The staffs were helpful and kind. Our room was clean and very comfortable. Upon arrival, we were given warm cookies and complementary breakfast voucher. Nice and it was DELICIOUS! The kids loved the indoor swimming pool. That was mainly the reason why we chose this hotel every summer. Great location, close to freeways, close to shopping area, close to a lot fast food/restaurants. Loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: crazyhotelguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Mission Valley area of San Diego several times in the past couple of years for business. In this time, I have experienced a couple of different hotels in this area and I have to say that to date, the Doubletree is my favorite. Overall, the only true negative of this property is the fact that it is strarting to look a little dated. Despite this, the hotel is still VERY clean and comfortable. The decor is warm and inviting. I would however have preferred a proper office chair for the desk. To make a long review short, I will simply list the pros and cons of this hotel from my perspective. PROS: -Rooms are clean and comfortable. -Location is wonderful. Very close to shopping, restaurants, and entertainment. Also, the Trolley stop is just across the street. -i had a great view from my balcony of the vally. -Its a Doubletree, so obviously, the cookies are a great addition. -The staff is very friendly and helpful CONS: -Decor is becoming a little dated. -Parking is an onsite garage. While it seems to be plentiful, beware that the spaces are VERY tight in certain areas. If you arrive back late to the hotel on a busy night, you may have trouble parking that Lincoln Town Car. (You might get parked, but won't be able to open the door).... It is San Diego and parking is limited.... NEUTRAL: -Be aware that Parking is an extra charge, as it is at most of the hotels in this area. They offer a Business plan that can save you money on this by adding in parking and internet. -The Breakfast buffet is adequate, but could use a little more variety.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed..Never to Return”
Reviews.Author: SDtime
Reviews.Content: Very Disappointed. Original room booked was not available 30 minutes after check in time. We upgraded our room at additional cost and was given a room right over the freeway and next to roof air conditioning compressors. No way to sleep. People walked in to our room after management assigned the same room to another party. Room had hint of cigarettes even though it was stated as non-smoking. We will never return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “CARE culture is great only if practiced”
Reviews.Author: Maj77
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve traveled to more than 25 countries and stayed at different types of accommodation and this hotel ends up on the rather short list of disappointments. On the positive side, the room is huge â€“ bigger by European or even American standards, bed and linens are soft and comfortable, the location is good, and I like their environment-friendly policies and Neutrogena toiletries. The hotel has adapted a CARE culture and seems to be genuine in their commitment to making their guestsâ€™ stay pleasurable. However, the staff who received us upon check-in seemed to have had a bad day - we were left to wait for 5 minutes before we were entertained (he was on the phone), didnâ€™t apologize for keeping us wait, and didnâ€™t bother to utter welcoming words, and the check in itself was slow. This normally doesn't concern me a great deal but it was 9:30pm when we arrived in the hotel and our 11-month old baby was already sleeping after a long 8-hour car ride from Williams, Arizona. All we needed was to get the hotel key quick and deal with the payment etc afterwards. (She woke up eventually at the lobby while waiting). Also, upon check-in, guests are supposed to receive freshly baked chocolate chip cookie as a symbol of their warm hospitality but we didnâ€™t get that either. Not that it matters really. But the gesture would have been appreciated. I had been a hotel desk receptionist in my younger years so I understand the importance of customer service to a certain degree and I must say I was disappointed when we checked in because after all, first impression lasts. Meanwhile, contrary to whatâ€™s advertised in the website, internet connection wasnâ€™t free in my case for some reason. I was automatically directed to a Hilton HHonors website where I was supposed to pay the internet by credit card or otherwise charged to my room. And there is no refrigerator either. I should have known about this earlier but I just thought this is a given â€“ a basic room amenity. And again, maybe I was a bit naÃ¯ve but I was expecting complimentary water since there is a coffeemaker and complimentary Wolfgang Puck coffee for free. Instead, an Icelandic water bottle is available for US5. And parking costs as well. In general, I'm not too keen on hotels that have hiddgen costs for things that normally should be available for free or at least these small fees should just be included in the room charge. In short, I wasnâ€™t too happy or satisfied with this Hilton-member hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in area”
Reviews.Author: Eileen Joan
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, only there one night & would have liked one more nt. Has indoor & outdoor pool so good if you go in winter.Room very quite even with a group of schoolgirls on our floor. Plenty of eating places within walking distance of hotel Joe's Crab Shack good food & fun place for all age groups. We were going to Seaworld which was just wonderful. Don't pay for car parking at hotel, we parked across the steet from hotel & got a place at 6p.m. Go to Seaworld by 10a.m. Go to the new dolphin show first as it gets busy also the Rapids ride. They even have a machine you stand in ($5 two can fit) to get dried off if the sun doesn't do it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: naduah
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, while visiting our Navy son and his wife. The lobby is lovely and everyone there as helpful as they could be. We booked a King Deluxe and our room was great. Everything was very clean and it was quiet. The room was spacious. The bedding was soooo comfy. We slept great. We will go there again next time, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice but.......”
Reviews.Author: HBBear
Reviews.Content: Great location just outside the busy and congested city but only a couple of minute drive to all the city has to offer. All in all, very nice. Big rooms, very clean, great lobby, very helpful front desk employees. Close to a lot of shopping, restaurants, theaters. All right at your door step. The negatives are just a few. Paper thin walls where you can hear people in the bathroom next to you. I heard a whole conversation of where the couple next to us was going to go to dinner. Also, no fans in the bathrooms. And, no refrigerators in the rooms. Old style tube TV's. Was kinda surprised about the refrigerators and the TV's since this is an mid-to-upscale type hotel. Self-parking in $15 per day which always upsets me, but what can you do. It would be different if this were right down-town but it is kinda in a suburban type area so why charge for parking. Oh, you have to pay for the internet in your room too. I think it was somewhere between $12-$14 per day. It's not a cheap hotel, I don't know why they have to nickle and dime you. But, all in all, I would probably stay here again since the location is great for me and what I go to the city for.

Reviews.Title: “great place and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: TheBestOnly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! It is very central. The service is great ... very friendly staff and a nice view of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, friendly.”
Reviews.Author: oztravman
Reviews.Content: I originally booked the Doubletree Del Mar, but then changed to this hotel due to its location. It is located adjacent to the Hazard Centre which has a cinema, restaurants a few shops and a trolley stop. Our main purpose of our trip to San Diego was to visit Tijuana and you can get there via the trolley out the front with only one trolley change. The front desk staff was very friendly and welcoming. The room was nice, quiet and clean. The breakfast buffet was OK, it was included in our package so we just had cereal and fruit but there was the usual scrambled eggs, bacon but also had french toast. The hotel has two pools, an outdoor and an indoor and both are heated. It also has a print facility which was handy to print our tickets to the zoo. The trolley also provides easy access to the Gaslamp Quarter and waterfront. Overall we had a great stay at this hotel, the staff were great, the location is great if you want to use the trolley and the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great location, Large Rooms, All the facilities you need”
Reviews.Author: F1Crazy
Reviews.Content: We visited San Diego to do the usual - Sea World, Zoo and Wild Animal Park. We stayed at this hotel because of its proximity to Sea World and the Zoo and because its a Doubletree The hotel is very nice, convenient to get to and the staff are friendly and helpful. It is close to attractions and also to Fashion Valley Mall, the largest Mall in San Diego. You have a wide choice of places to eat, from fast food to fancy within a 5 - 7 minute drive. Their concierge and bell desk are just about the best I've seen anywhere - always willing to help and with great local information. We were 8 people in 2 rooms and were driving a 12 passenger van, we stayed 4 days. They not only found a place to park it for us (it wouldnt fit in their underground garage) but they even honoured our free parking deal which was really meant for a standard car or SUV. The rooms are fabulous - spacious and very comfortable for 4. The hotel offers free high speed internet, on site washer dryer, an indoor and outdoor pool and best of all, offer Starbucks Coffee on site (a full Starbucks is only a 3 minute walk)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Amenities, Good Services, BUTâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: MannyH
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dated. You can tell at some point in time these rooms were updated, probably not that long ago but it was only to mask what was hidden underneath. The obvious was the â€œpopcornâ€� ceiling. The minute you see any hotel with â€œpopcornâ€� ceiling will probably mean there will be some short-comings.. ie: cheap dÃ©cor, old fixtures like bathtub drains or under the sink plumbing, dirty tile grout, old doors, peeling wallpaper, rusting walls, no microwave, no fridge and old TVâ€™s instead of newer flat screens, (tubes are so 80â€™s!). This place had all of the above. Now let me say itâ€™s not a bad hotel, just donâ€™t expect much as far as luxury or cleanliness. Its basically a hotel that had gone through a very decent upgrade, minus a couple of things but has gone through the mills since then. I think that its just as if this hotel goes through so many occupants that it just couldnâ€™t handle itâ€¦ hereâ€™s another example: The have 2 gas fire pits out near the outdoor pool. The fire pit spits out 3 fires through fire rings and lava rocks. Well on one of the fire pits only 2 of the 3 fire rings were working. Upon further inspection the next morning in day light I took noticed that the third fire ring that wasnâ€™t working was so beyond rusted it had brittled away. So this means it has not been replaced for quite some time. Two pools are better than one! Now they got that right, to include allowing you to swim in the indoor one 24/7. The outdoor pool is very spacious and little oneâ€™s will have a grand time floating around the 3 Â½ foot deep side of the pool while all the rowdy teenagers put each other on their shoulders and wrestle on the 5 foot side. On the other hand the jacuzzi is super small. Its max capacity is 6. Seems kind of odd when you have two sizeable pools and everyone keeps sneaking up to the jacuzzi to check if thereâ€™s an open spot to warm up from the cool May California breeze. It has a decent hotel gym and a nice sauna. The food is ok. Window Lounge had a small but hearty menu. Be sure to get the breakfast package when staying because I can see Applebees right across the way getting old every morning. At least with the breakfast package you can mix up your omelet to your liking every day. Speaking of Applebees, its not a far walk from the hotel. Itâ€™s gotten bad reviews on other sites but if you know what you want it is a decent choice for food to go at pool side. The All American Grill is also next to the hotel and serves great food but can be a bit loud especially if a games going on. Go Lakers! As mentioned by previous reviewers this place is in a great location! Literally walk and shop! Well for me, my favorite was Yogurtland. For my wife, Barnes and Noble and of courseâ€¦ Starbucks. Thereâ€™s Mexican, Japanese, Fast food and a grocery store within walking distance. Thereâ€™s a movie theater within yards and a trolley station across the street that will take you just about all directions in San Diego. So yea, the location rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Fernierules
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the doubletree for 4 nights in late may. This is my secound time staying here and there is a reason why I decided to book here again. The only bad thing about this hotel is they just recently discontinued the curtosy shuttle to and from the airport. It's unfortunate but it's not really considered a "airport hotel". We arrived early and the from desk gave us a few options if we wanted to check in early. For us it dident matter so we took a 3rd floor room and we were happy. At night I can understand peoples complaints about the freeway (our windows were open the entire time we were there) but the noise really wasent that bad at all, and as forthright trolly noise couldent hear it go by at night. (trolly service ends at midnight). Since we disent opt to rent a car we payed 14$ for a 4 day trolly pass which also covers transit. We went to seaworld (can be accessed by bus) or around a 18$ cab ride from the hotel, we also went to th zoo and it ended up being a 19$ cab ride there. So great location to both of these places. We took the trolly then bus to mission beach which was about a 15 min ride. Fashion valley mall is worth checking out when our staying there it's the next stop on the trolly from the hotel. All in all great hotel, great service and it's worth talking to the guys who grab cars and call taxis they know alot about places around the area. I shouldent also mention they allowed us to check out an hour later, but I'm sure that depended on how full the hotel was. Oh yeah if your polite enough they'll end up giving you some more of those delicious cookies they have, we ended up with about 6 for our plane ride home.

Reviews.Title: “Good value next to the trolley”
Reviews.Author: Fitch7600
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is a perfect compromise between expensive downtown properties and being out in the sticks. This is a clean comfortable property with a great pool area and a decent restaurant. It is connected via a second floor footbridge to a shopping center that has restaurants, bookstores and a movie theater. There are a couple of huge malls that are one trolley stop away. That trolley stop is directly across a very small, quiet street from the hotel. It can take you to most of the hot spots in the area quickly and cheaply, We went to a baseball game at Petco and being able to skip traffic was a pleasure. We had a group block that included parking, internet and breakfast. There may otherwise be a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: njs23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip. At check-in, the person at front desk was very rude and unhelpful, and talked to me with an attitude. My business package included free parking, but she incorrectly charged me and 2 of my co-workers $15 per night for parking. The machine that controls the access gate to the hotel guest parking structure did not seem to work after check-out for me and another co-worker, and we needed to contact the front desk for assistance. I have opted out of the $15/day internet and and $20 breakfast buffet as I consider the price to be too expensive. I also consider the $15/night parking.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Mission Valley, San Diego :: awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveSOCAL2010
Reviews.Content: Over spring break, we stayed at the Double Tree Mission Valley Hotel I went with my 2 daughters and met up with my best friend and her 2 daughters. We had the shuttle get us at the airport which was very handy and had a very quick and easy check in .The room was more than spacious for us 3 girls and the bathroom was nice too. Very clean and bright room. I am a light sleeper, so I did notice the traffic from the highway outside of our room window which faced the pool but when I talked with Mark, the manager at the front desk, he immediately moved us to a different area of the hotel which was quieter. The beds and pillows were very comfy and made sleeping easier. We had breakfast each morning downstairs and had the buffet which was delicious and really convenient. The service was fantastic. Every time we stepped foot back into the hotel or were off for a day of fun, Mark always said hello and called me by my name which was impressive. He was very professional. The hotel is very conveniently located close to the trolley and shopping and restaurants were very close. We were lucky to have parked on the street outside the hotel which did save us $14 a night which was nice.. The pools were both very nice and the indoor pool was excellent because it was so warm, that the kids did not want to get out! We did have to pay for each of us to take the shuttle bus back to the airport which was pricey but cheaper than a cab and the driver was so friendly! Overall, we loved San Diego. loved La Jolla and the seal beach (a MUST SEE!), loved the Mexican food in Old Town and did a harbour cruise which was a fun way to see San Diego!! I completely recommend this hotel and hope your stay goes as well as ours!! If not, just ask for Mark!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with wonderful amenities and accessible location!”
Reviews.Author: Bella12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Mission Valley during spring break and regardless of the other "negative" reviews listed here, we had an incredible time! First off the staff was awesome, everyone was helpful and very kind. Mark the Manager in particular was extremely accomodating, as was the maid service and the wonderful sales lady Debbie in the gift shop. The rooms were a good size, the beds and pillows to die for, and we had a mini balcony which overlooked the pool and palm trees, it was beautiful. As for noise, sure there is a freeway and a trolley, but it wasn't loud, just a little hummm. The indoor pool is warm like a bathtub (no exaggeration), we didn't use the outdoor one because it was cool when we were there, but it looked nice. The hot tub however was hot and soothing. The grounds were well kept and beautiful. They had firepits going most nights, which was very relaxing after a long day! We had the breakfast buffet which came with an additional price of room, but very reasonable and it was delicious, service in the dining room excellent as well. We felt safe in the area, used parking across the street, and could amost walk over to the fast food and grocery stores in the area. The only negative was that the fridge I was given didn't work, but I was given another one a few days before I left and wasn't charged for it. As before, we enjoyed our stay, very clean, (I am picky), and we found air conditioning, as well as all our requests for extra towels, more than taken care of. We could also use the free internet and print our boarding passes, which was a plus. There was also a fitness centre, but after walking all day at the zoo, who could go on a treadmill! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and would definitely stay here again when we come back to lovely San Diego! PS Going up to La Jolla is a must for anyone coming here, a quick 20 min drive up the coast.

Reviews.Title: “Great full service hotel”
Reviews.Author: penguinman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on business. This is a great full service hotel. Located right off Route 5 and 8. The highway noise is pretty daunting, and you really can't keep the slider open in nice weather. The Red Trolley is quiet and you won't even hear it. Windows lounge has daily happy hour prices and a great beer selection on tap.. The Fountain restr has a great breakfast buffet. Service was always good. The Hotel is also located next to the Fashion Valley Mall for high end shopping. I have a few constructive comments to make about the hotel and hope they will take them seriously. First of all, the internet is VERY slow, my download speeds were under 50K all week , that is more like dial up speed. For the prices most people have to pay for internet, this hotel has the bankroll to upgrade this service and I hope they do so. Very discouraging to have to wait 5-10 min for a work presentation to download!! Secondly, the bathrooms are very dated (as observed by other guests). I could not agree more, they don't fit in with the room style. So I hope they will re-do the bathrooms soon. I was in on a full business package, so parking, breakfast and internet was included for my stay. I can understand why some people feel there are 'hidden charges', but if you did your research you would have known about this up front. I had a good overall stay and would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Hidden Fees! They lurk everywhere at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mawokc
Reviews.Content: I was disgusted with this hotel. We booked our reservations online and they were offering $60 a night. We arrived at Doubletree and learned that they charge $14/day just to park there. What was horrible about this was that there is nothing you can do about it once you arrive! You have to pay it!! There is nowhere to park without being towed. Then we learned that to use their wi-fi, it's $12/day. Why not just make the room $86 and include these things in the price? I wanted my vacation to be paid for when I arrived so I didn't have to worry about such petty things. Breakfast was around $16-$19 per person. It would have been nice to have known in advance about these fees. The room I stayed in had one pathetic excuse for an air conditioning unit on the wall. This did not get the room cooled down at all. The lights needed to be changed and the drains were all very slow. The staff at the front desk were rude. They never said hello and didn't bother to thank us for staying there when we checked out. I wouldn't reccomend this place to my worst enemy. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor maintenance”
Reviews.Author: doctoro2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and super clean... also, you've gotta love those chocolate chips cookies you get when you check in. However, we couldn't sleep because the thermostat kept resetting to 75, which was just too hot. After calling the front desk and being told that there was no one from maintenance on-site that late in the evening, the only thing we could do was open the window. Being close to the highway prevented any chance of getting some good sleep. Additionally, there was a problem with the drain in the bathtub, so I had to shower with the water rising above my feet. The woman at the front desk the next morning was polite and understanding and offered us free breakfast, which would have otherwise cost $20/person. It was nice, but the hotel bill really should have been comped, as I could have gotten the same quality of sleep in my car.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in San Diego close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlnDixie45
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree San Diego-Mission Valley and was impressed with the hotel and the service. It is conveniently located off the freeway and close to many restaurants. The hotel itself is very well kept, friendly staff, smooth check-in and rooms are comfortable and spacious. You receive a warm chocolate chip cookie upon arrival, too (nice touch)! You have to pay for overnight parking ($14), but during the day it's free. My room was ready (requested early check-in) on the 11th floor which was for HHonors members. Room was well kept with a spacious, comfortable bed and pillows. There is a coffee maker with Wolfgang Puck coffee which is a great plus before heading out in the morning. The bathroom is a good size with Neutrogena products for you to use, in case you forgot something. Soothing shower, robes to use, hairdryer, and an iron and board in the closet if you need. It is across the street from a trolley that takes you to the Gaslamp and other attractions. I plan to return to San Diego soon and will book here again!

Reviews.Title: “It's located on Hazard Center Drive for a reason”
Reviews.Author: wwwstudyofmakeupcom
Reviews.Content: It was raining the night I arrived at this Doubletree. The sliding glass door on my room was a few inches open and their were sheets by the door to soak up the water coming in from the balcony. The door wouldn't lock (or even close for that matter) so I was given another room; both rooms were outdated and smelled like someone had sprayed cheap perfume in them. The Double Tree Club hotel San Diego is a better value with plush, updated rooms. Parking downstairs in the garage is $14 but street parking is readily available and I had no problems parking on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: DaveSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I read some of the previous reviews with trepidation. I'm a former San Diego native who was back in town to visit friends so I knew exactly where the hotel sits. The hotel is in a great location to downtown, zoo, sea world, old town and the beaches. The staff is friendly, the room I had was clean, large enough for family with a nice suite set up. The bed was as comfortable as home. The pool and jacuzzi is great for family time after a day of excursions. By the way...I stay in hotels for at least 20 business trips per year so I see 2 to 4 star hotels constantly. I also like that I can get a large cup of Starbucks coffee for free next to the restaurant. I recommend this place for families on vacation. The only drawback is paying for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be a Great Property - Not Any More”
Reviews.Author: DesertExec
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for periods ranging from 1-4 nights on numerous and frequent occasions over th last several years, so am in a good position to judge the changes. In essence, what once was a well run and excellent property has slid into mediocrity on many levels over the last two years. My understanding is that they have had a change in management, which has not improved anything that I can see. In fact, just the opposite. In all fairness, much of the staff team has been there for years and many of them are excellent. It's the person making the strategic decisions, however, that I hold accountable. Housekeeping and maintenance have gone down hill. The pool areas and restrooms off the indoor pool are often filthy and without fresh towels. There was a change in the room srvice menu that left few choices, none especially well prepared from my experience. The property has been talking about a renovation for quite some time, yet little has been done. I am certain that this is a reflection of the economy, but for this hotel to remain competitive, it needs new management and an infusion of cash to update the rooms and facilities. I will not stay there again until improvements are made.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-par - avoid”
Reviews.Author: marca_pola
Reviews.Content: 1. They didn't clean our room until after 6 pm!!! I had to leave at 5:15 so they could clean. I came back 45 mins later - still not cleaned! Had to leave again at 6:05. The front desk was useless. This was disgusting. 2. We called at 10 am re: the clogged sink in bathroom. At 6 pm they still hadn't looked at it. The cleaning ladies who finally did examine it poured some black soot in it and left it like that. Apparently they took my complaints about the late cleaning personally. 2. The location is in the middle of a shopping mall, next to the freeway. If you're looking for a place where you can walk out of your hotel and experience the charming parts of San Diego, this is definitely not it. 3. We paid $10/night extra for a balcony. It was a two-foot concrete strip overlooking the freeway! There was no room for a chair or table, even if anybody wanted to drink in car fumes! In sum: avoid this place and spend your money somewhere you can get some charm and decent service. While the rates are good and the room per se is comfy enough, the negatives are decisive.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad... but won't come back here”
Reviews.Author: Thinker_to_go
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review for the Trump Plaza in Vegas that be relevant for this one: it's all about expectations. Sorry to say this hotel didn't meet my--not too high--expectations. I'll say off the bat, however, that I booked thru the American Express Travel website as a combination (air-hotel-car) deal, so I don't know how much the hotel cost by itself. That's important because it would normally help me assess what to expect (vs. what I get) to measure my level of satisfaction. The hotel is nice: fairly clean, located conveniently (not too far away from downtown, but not too close either), and the rooms were ok. As usual with Hilton hotels, the beds were awesome. Unlike other Hiltons, though, the bathroom and the TV were small, the room was ordinary and the hotel itself looked slightly unkempt (not dirty, mind you, just not 100% tidy). The cookie--though always nice to get one--was probably a couple of days old... As many other choices as there are in San Diego, I find it hard to recommend this property to a friend. But if someone already booked there, I wouldn't tell him/her to change, either.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms and the best Chocolate chip cookies”
Reviews.Author: mmandavis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located next to a great shopping Mall Fashion Valley. The inside and outdoor pools were a big hit with the kids. The most memorable however, are the fresh warm chocolate chip cookies you get upon arrival. They were great. The rooms are roomy. However, the bathroom in unimpressive and could be cleaner. No makeup mirror.

Reviews.Title: “The location was great and the hotel staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: reggaemusicfan
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at this hotel. I traveled by myself and felt very safe in the environment around the hotel. The shopping center next door was easily accessible through a connected walkway, and had several good eating choices, the trolley stop was just across the street, and the staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The complimentary airport shuttle pickup was one of the reasons I chose this hotel. (Going back to the airport is $10, a real deal also!) Because I didn't rent a car, the convenience of riding the trolley was great for a first timer to San Diego. The room was very clean and room service was efficient at 10:30 at night. The lounge was very cozy. I never got to eat at the restaurant, but the gift shop had wonderful coffee and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable safe and street car access”
Reviews.Author: offtherock165
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, overall enjoyed it. Parking was expensive at $14 per night, but I found street parking that was just a few minutes away. Lobby has open interet acess. Quality of room and bedding was excellent. Decent size room. Room was quiet. Street car is across the street for $1.50 can go anywhere in San Diego. We went to Harbor, Gas light district and Old town (for Mexican dinner with mariachi band playing. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good pool and trolley access but badly needs upcoming updates”
Reviews.Author: J_ROPE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend while attending a wedding nearby. The hotel itself is situated in sprawly Mission Valley, sandwiched between two large malls and adjacent to a shopping center. We were hoping for something a bit more walkable, although it is nice to be just across the street from the trolley which can take you to nicer places with better restaurant choices. The nearby restaurant choices are limited to chains: denny's, applebee's, Joe's crab shack, "all-american grill", quizno's, and more if you head across the freeway to Fashion Valley Mall. We did so on foot, at our own risk, luckily were sidewalks but not many crosswalks so it was a bit hairy. The mall is literally less than half a mile away but like I said, it's not a very walkable area. The hotel is surrounded by busy boulevards and highways so freeway noise is noticeable, but to be expected in that area. Our room was advertised as a "deluxe balcony". This was perhaps the greatest disappointment. The balcony did not even have enough room to pull a chair out on, useful only for a smoking fix, although you're technically probably only supposed to do that in smoking rooms. The king bed was very comfy and good pillows too. Parking was a bit confusing, we accidentally came in the back way and so we drove through the shopping center and parked underground. The hotel website had advertised that parking was $18/day. I think if you entered the garage the front way maybe that was true, but the paid parking is easy to circumvent, lots of street and shopping center parking. The pool area is very nice and private with good tree cover, but not too much to get in the way of tanning. Would be a good place for kids. There is also an indoor spa that I did not go in but looked nice and seemed to be working. There are two large firepits outside by the pool adjacent to the bar, which would be a good place to hang out and have a drink, however the drinks at the bar "Windows" were outrageously priced. An amber ale was $6.25 and a Coors light was $5.75. Ridiculous. A 4-6pm happy hour brings those prices down, but only by a bit. We dined in the restaurant for breakfast, they had a $19 buffet, we went ala carte instead, which was decent, though pricey. Service was friendly, but slow and they seemed understaffed considering it was a Chargers game and they should have expected to be busy. They give you a warm cookie when you check in and one at turn down service. A nice touch. I would stay here again, but only if they keep the price of the room low. I would also bring my own alcohol. The rooms were clean and nice but in need of updating, which according to a vague sign in the lobby, it seemed like they were contemplating.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS”
Reviews.Author: kansas1111
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so clean and very modern. This hotel was so close to everything we did. A garmin is a must!! We visited San Diego for 8 days. We had the San Diego pass which was awesome. We did San Diego zoo, Wild Animal Park(which takes 1/2 day), Sea World(not with pass but got 2 adults $55 each and our child was free), Scripps aquarium(probably spelled wrong), triple kayak in La Jolla, Boomers one evening, Wavehouse surf(my husband did for a hour and loved), Belmont Park(wouldn't have paid for but was free with pass and went for 1 hour one evening), legoland/sea life (could have been 2 days but with pass only get 1 day), north and south harbour tour, uss museum(which was great) Places to eat wahoo(spelling might be wrong), fish market(a must and ate there twice), in/out burger, nick's were some of are favorites. Best beaches were coronado(spelliing probably wrong)and mission beach. Everbody says La Jolla but we thought not so much.Also, go to seaport village. Sorry for all the missed spelled words but doing this in a hurry. Also, I pretty sure if you need a frig you can ask for one(saw some sitting outside of rooms while they were cleaned. Also, grocery store and target very very close to hotel. We had bananas and cereal for breakfast almost every am, we got milk in the gift shop. Don't pay for parking, plenty of parking on street or behind hotel in shopping area. We got this hotel for like 54.88 on 1800hotels.com. Go to old town for great mexican food

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: UAfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days this past weekend - one room had a king bed and the other had 2 queens. The rooms were big and roomy, especially the king room. The lobby, hallways and rooms were very clean and everything looked new (I believe they had recently laid new carpet). I thought it looked great! The service was wonderful - everyone we encountered was super friendly. It's in a great area near lots of shopping, restaurants, and the freeways. Downtown was 5 min away and the beaches were 10 min away. I will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Safe & Enjoyable for a Single Traveler”
Reviews.Author: AZTraveler200012
Reviews.Content: Staying an extra day after a Marine Corps graduation family event. Felt very safe. Easy to find location. Excellent shopping within walking distance. Staff was warm and welcoming. Everything I hoped for......plus a cookie!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Doubletree Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: sandnsun61
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights whilst visiting daughter at SDSU for Family Weekend. We got a great rate on the Doubletree website for an advance purchase. King room was adequate ... nothing special but certainly comfortable. Proximity to the Trolley was a huge plus for us as we didn't even rent a car for our visit. When we arrived on Friday at 9am (after departing a cruise ship) of course our room was not yet ready. We checked in and the desk took my cell phone number to call us when the room was done. Less than an hour later we were at SDSU and the hotel called to let us know we could get into our room. What service! Lindsay, one of the Bellmen, was simply awesome. This hotel was perfect for the weekend. It's not a resort by any means, but a nice option for visiting San Diego. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my vacation...”
Reviews.Author: azbaker
Reviews.Content: This was a disaster from the beginning of check in to check out. I am a diamond hilton honors member and when I checked in the front desk told me if I could wait 1 hour then she would put me in a nicer, bigger room. We agreed because we thought we would get a bite to eat then come back. The room wasn't ready in an hour. Nor was it on the right side of the hotel as told. I opened the door and it was like being on the shoulder of the freeway. You coud really hear the traffic. I went back down to complain and it was a new person behind the desk who put me in the room that I refused an hour and a half ago. My profile states that I do not want a room near the elevator. It was the first room from the elevator and Mark Rincon from the front desk said that was the only room available. They were sold out and the original room that I was supposed to get was already given to someone else. He comped us breakfast that next morning. I don't normally do the breakfasts for two reasons: they aren't healthy or good. I have on my profile that I want the reward points. So since that was given to us, we went upstairs to the breakfast on the executive floor just for some decaf and bananas for the road. There were eggs but that was it. The fruit platter was empty. There was a bagel on a platter and there was no decaf. When you pumped the coffee container grounds spit out at you. I took my cup downstairs when I checked out and was told someone would bring us two cups of decaf from the gift shop. Well after waiting my husband went to the gift shop and the woman behind the counter told him he could pump his two complimentary cups. What a waste of time both days. I didn't sleep well from the people getting off the elevator and going down the hallway talking. I made a complaint and got a really unsincere apology from Mark. I highly recommend the HIlton Gaslamp for your stay in San Diego. I tried this hotel because that one was sold out and it was a huge mistake. It really did ruin our day in CA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: EuroDiva
Reviews.Content: Husband and I spent 2 nights at the Doubletree. Room was spacious, bed was comfortable. The bathroom walls and ceiling had several spots of moisture damaged pockets. Ample paid parking adjacent to hotel, but parking stalls are tight. Free internet in business center located in the lobby. Convenient location to movie theaters, shopping and restaurants - all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Iansfamily
Reviews.Content: Good location, opposite tram stop and close to main roads but far enough not to suffer noise. The hotel looked very nice but our room was small, had no fridge and we could never get enough towels delivered for our party of 4. It just didn't quite deliver as it should and could have done. It was OK, no more.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: NmKster
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very comfortable bed big rooms, loved the couch! Clean, good housekeeping staff Big pool and jacuzzi balconies Cons: You can't go from the pool to your room without walking through the main lobby Long walk from parking garage through lobby to rooms Noisy a bit shabby, especially the public areas - clean, just old NO FREE WI-FI

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice price”
Reviews.Author: Papai
Reviews.Content: I took my mom to San Diego for a 3-day getaway from Phoenix. The hotel, itself, was what we expected in a Doubletree-great service, clean and comfortable beds, and value. It was the best price for this class of hotel. The pools were great. The inside pool literally was like bath water, the outside pool was refreshing during the day. As reviewers' mentioned, the trolley (a train actually) stop is right in front of the hotel, and can either take you directly to major attractions or connect you to buses that do. It was pretty easy to navigate, and staff at the hotel were very helpful. It was $5 per day to ride all day. We did not even rent a car, an most places you park charge high daily rates to park there. The hotel shuttle picked us up at the airport for free and $10 back. We spent a day at Sea World, and one day touring the US Midway and the harbor. On the negative side--the hotel is near a very busy and loud highway. The hotel also boasts that it is next to a 3-story shopping plaza within walking distance, the Hazard Center. It is very close, but most of the businesses have closed down. There's a few cafe's and 3 resaurants, and a movie theater. If you're two women wanting to shop, this is not the place. The good news was we just took the trolley one stop away to the mall. Overall though, this hotel would be one I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel experience in my hometown.”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust83103
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the DoubleTree Mission Valley to attend my 20 high school class reunion and as San Diego was my hometown, I hadn't had much opportunity for hotels there, but this exceeded my expectations more than I can say. My daughter was only 10 months old at the time and they gave us a comfy crib and microwave to heat her milk. We loved the daily toll house cookies. It's so central to everything. As someone who prides themself on speaking on behalf of native San Diegans when someone I know visits there, I can't imagine a better place to stay for the money. Great deal, service, food. Will DEFINITELY stay there again. LOVE LOVE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: BBockoven
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night visiting our daughter, and after staying in several other nearby properties along Hotel Circle, this is the one we will come back to. Negatives were an ineffective A/C and an unfriendly waitress at the pool, but convenience and price weigh more than those issues. Valet Parking in the garage is an unreasonable $18, but streetside parking, or in the adjacent shopping area were both free and absolutely an acceptable option. Trolley is a great convenience for getting you anywhere in the city, from the Old Towne, to the Convention Center, Seaport Village, ball park...

Reviews.Title: “Room not cool at ALL!”
Reviews.Author: travel4wrk
Reviews.Content: The rooms were extremely warm. Hotel staff said that it was for conservation purposes. Hey...I am all for conservation as I am an environmentalist by education and experience; however, I am not for conservation at the expense of your guests especially when the common areas in the hotel feels like an icebox! I had to speak with someone several times before the engineer came to reset the thermostat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Civil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights while visiting family and doing some sight seeing in San Diego. It is an absolute perfect location! We rented a car for the couple days, however with the trolley across the street, we only used the car once our entire stay. The trolley made it easy to get around the city. The staff at the hotel was always great, explaining how to get to certain places, and mailing our postcards for us. The hotel offers wireless Internet at $12 a day, but I got lucky and my room had a couple open networks available, probably coming from the nearby subdivision. We avoided the restaurant downstairs, primarily because of previous reviews, plus there is so much available in the area (some within walking distance) that we never felt the need to stay in. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family trip”
Reviews.Author: maggiec99
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Doubletree for our family trip to San Diego last September. I was a little worried about the location being further from the sites but it turned out perfect for us. My children (3 and 6) loved riding the train into downtown and Old Town for our sightseeing. We bought a multiday pass for the MTS and used the trains to get everywhere. Due to our HHonors status we were given access to the executive floor. The service was wonderful here. We met the kindest lady who managed this room and looked after us each morning for breakfast. She even offered to bring us coupons for Legoland that she had at home. After our day at the zoo the children were too exhausted to drag to a restaurant and we made our dinner out of the snacks at evening reception. This is not something I would normally do (we love to eat out), but it was the perfect solution for us that night. We also experienced outstanding service from the front desk. Upon our arrival at the airport, we called the Doubletree to request the free airport shuttle. We were told it would be 40 minutes before they could pick us up, so we should just take a cab and they would pay for it. Of course the cab driver said he would not wait for the hotel to pay. So as my husband was getting our bags and handing over our credit card to pay for the cab I walked inside to be met by the bellman who was waiting specifically for us. When I told him my husband was paying he literally ran outside and stopped the cab driver from taking my husband's card. What could have been a very bad first impression of the hotel turned out to be an excellent first impression. By the way, while the shuttle is free from the airport to the hotel, when you are needing transportation back to the airport it is $10 a person. Our children were free though. We swam in both pools (indoor and outdoor) used the exercise facilities and the hot tub. The gym was quite busy when we were there. Our only complaint would be the internet service. There was no free connection in the room and a charge to use the business center computers. My husband took his lap top to the lobby one night to take advantage of the free wifi in the lobby and found that even down there getting a connection was a problem. Overall this was a perfect stay for our family. We loved San Diego. Our children talk about it frequently and have fond memories of hopping aboard the train/trolley across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again!”
Reviews.Author: erin182
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night but it was clean, roomy and had excellent staff who were friendly and very helpful with whatever enquiries we had. The trolley stop right across the road was fantastic and helped us get everywhere we needed to go. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good deal but beware of additional fees”
Reviews.Author: dl2hbx
Reviews.Content: Pro: Good deal on Hotwire Amenities Large room Con: Parking fees Internet fees Breakfast not included Expensive Shuttle Road noise from Highways Broken shower Indoor Pool out of order Not the most recent hotel No fridge, no microwave The hotel is a three star property that we got for a very good rate on Hotwire. Teh room was up to the expected standard with comfortable beds and amenities. However, there are a lot of additional fees that less expensive hotels in the area do not ask for, such as parking, internet or airport shuttle. Some other issues did not exactly help to get beyond three stars in our review.

Reviews.Title: “A warm environment”
Reviews.Author: ectothegecko
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel through priceline.com. It was great to be greeted with a warm cookie at check-in and the staff was incredibly friendly. There is a charge to park at the hotel but there is free parking available in the adjacent neighborhood. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. The lobby was nothing spectacular but the friendliness of the staff made the hotel stand out. The hotel was convenient to dining and downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: TrulyCanadian786
Reviews.Content: Airport Shuttle is great and complimentary. Most airports have a phone that connects you to the hotel but SAN Diego Airport did not have such phone. This was a nuissance, had to use a pay phone to contact the hotel so they would come pick us up. Other than that the hotel is beautiful, clean, 4 star quality. Close to the upscale mall. Loved it. booked via hotwire under $100usd

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not very clean”
Reviews.Author: CatMagnet2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family for one night. We got lost trying to find the hotel, so called the hotel to get directions. It took several minutes before they could find someone to give us directions. Finally found it, but it wasn't obvious. There's a sign by the shopping center that lists the hotel, but the hotel is actually in back of the center, off the side street. Check-in was friendly and efficient. Room was fairly spacious. There was the typical writing desk, desk chair, side chair and side table, armoire/TV and the beds. Not particularly clean: the carpet had seen better days and there was gum stuck on the floor in 2 places. The desk was sticky - probably from the coffee maker/fixing that were on the corner of the desk. But after driving all day we were too tired to move rooms. The coffee fixings were better than average - Wolfgang Puck brand and they actually didn't taste like sawdust. The room was quiet and the beds were better than average. Bathroom had little counterspace. Ate breakfast at the cafe on site (Fountains Cafe). while picturesque, the fountain also made it difficult to carry on a conversation due to the splashing water sounds. We had the breakfast buffet which was pricey, though not bad. There was the usual eggs/meats/pastries, as well as oatmeal and waffles. Service was friendly, though not particularly speedy. It took 15 minutes to try to find someone to get us our bill. Overall, it was acceptable, but not stellar. I'd stay here if I had to, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Irishgirl_286
Reviews.Content: If you read my other reviews you will see we visited the Intercontinental in San Francisco and the Palm Place in Las Vegas before reaching The Double Tree, Mission Valley in San Diego. On first impression when we entered the hotel we felt slightly let down as it seemed somewhat dated however we had just stayed in 2 spanking new hotels. All of the staff were really friendly during check in. The lift/elevator was very slow and noisey and when we entered our room it smelled slightly and was dated..........but that aside. This hotel is in a fantastic location, the trolley stop is directly across the street and very easy to use. 2 stops away is the huge Misson Valley Mall. You can also take the the trolley to the gas lamp and visit all the great pubs and restaurants and if you want to be more adventurous take the trolley to the last stop and spend the day at the premium outlet store which just border Mexico. We found some great bargains here. We also rented a car for a couple of days and visited the beach and the other outlet stores. We spent 5 days in this hotel and first impressions aside this was my favourite of the 3 hotels we stayed in. The staff were unbelievable friendly and remembered us each day, maybe we tipped well :-) The pool area is really relaxing and the sports bar at night had a good atmosphere. There was a charge to park in the hotel car park luckily for us the barrier was let up during our stay so the parking was free. To sum it up, very friendly staff, good rooms, good food, good pool and fantastic location. Will definately stay here again if I visit San Diego 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ap5459
Reviews.Content: This property has recently gone through an extensive renovation. They also left yummy choclate chip cookies in the room. The service was also really great. We visited Sea World and downtown San Diego and the location turned out to be great. Highly recommend this place and it felt like I was staying at the W. Alpa Patel

Reviews.Title: “All that glitters is not gold”
Reviews.Author: dream_chaser_69
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying in this hotel. The first time was about 5 years ago. They have since remodeled. They have added flat screen televisions and bunk beds in what they call their family suite. The first room I was assigned was right next to an ice machine and had only one t.v. Since I was traveling with my children, two televisions is a must. It was extremely noisy and since I had also requested not to be near an ice machine or an elevator when I booked the room, I asked to be moved. The second room had two televisions but was right by the elevator. Again very noisy. There was some teacher's convention going on at the hotel and they were very full, so we had to stay there for the night. The next day we were moved for a third time to a quiet room at the other end of the hall on a different floor away from the elevator and the ice machine and with 2 televisions. The third time was a charm. Though I preffered the bathroom set up in the first room we had better. Each room was a little different. All of them had bunk beds for the kids but one had a king bed and the other two had two queen beds. The on site restaurant I thought was over priced, but fortunately being so perfectly located in Mission Valley, there were plenty of other places to eat away from the hotel. The pool is nice. My kids had a great time in it. For the price I paid and having to play musical rooms, I was not overly impressed. The chocolate chip cookies that they give you at check in do not make up for the inconvenience or the $14 a day self parking fee that they charge. (Note: There is nowhere else to park so you are stuck with the fee.) Nor does it make up for the high cost of eating at their onsite restaurant. The flat screen televisions and the updated decor did not make up for the over $250 a night that we paid to stay there. I wil look for other accomodations next time I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Parking Fees, Misleading Room Rates”
Reviews.Author: jas8r4
Reviews.Content: We booked on Hotwire, which even states that hotels may have parking fees (in fine print). What disgusted us was you don't get what you pay for. We were charged an additional $15 a night for cramped parking. (See photo) These parking spots were narrow even for compact cars. There was a wedding one night and no parking spots were even available. So what was it we paid for? If Double Tree wants to charge an additional $15 a night for a room, they should raise their advertised room rates. They shouldn't hide a fee in fine print and call it a "service" when it is anything but!

Reviews.Title: “Chocolate cookies are the best way to start a stay!”
Reviews.Author: LFC79
Reviews.Content: On arrival you get a warm choc chip cookie - and you love the hotel already. The rooms were large a clean and we were on the 11 floor which gets you the breaky everyday. The lady in charge of that was lovely and made you feel very welcome. The exit at the 2nd floor gets you to the hazard centre which is nice a close with restaurants and cinema and some shops. Accross from the cinema is the 'trolley' which is easy to use when you figure out what way to go. The first stop away fromt he hotel is fashion vally which we didnt realise was a huge shopping centre just close to our hotel ( but not close enought to walk) 2$ gets you there! Further that way is downtown with more shops. You can also catch the trolley the other way to qualcom stadium so if there is a game on it is very handy - but it takes ages to get home as all 69000 people seemd to take the trolley!!!! The Guest services desk was fantastic in getting us tickets to the Football game so ask them for help. The hotel like many others had no fridge but that was the only bad thing. There is also a guest laundry hidden within the floors so it comes in handy!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: KEWLBEANS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on the reviews and a decent AAA rate. The front desk person was great, bell staff was great. Beds were great. A/C did not work, but 10 minutes after one phone call it was fixed. I asked to stay on the quite side, away from the highway but beware of nightlife nose and the beeps of trucks backing up in the garage that last into the night. I didn't like- the comforter in between two flat sheets (duvet covers would have been nicer) and a small refridgerator in the room would have been nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: xgirl76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in August and have no complaints. It is a standard business hotel, so nothing really thrilling about it, but nothing bad either. Rooms are nice enough size, with a sofa and small desk. Bathrooms are fine (once I figured out that the water wasn't running out because the drain cover was on, which wasn't clear from looking at it). It's a little run-down looking in parts, but clean. The warm cookie on check-in is a nice touch - I could have done with one every day! We had breakfast in the restaurant every morning and the selection is nice - the breakfast buffet is good value if you're hungry. There is a small indoor pool and a larger outdoor pool, though we didn't use either. They looked nice, however. We did use the coin laundry, which was handy for anyone on a longer trip who doesn't want to pay hotel laundry rates or carry bags of clothes out of the hotel to a public laundry. The hotel is located directly opposite a trolley stop, which was handy for going downtown, and the Fashion Valley shopping mall is one stop down. Overall this was an okay experience and for the price of hotels in San Diego, relatively good value.

Reviews.Title: “Probably a nice hotel -- if they honor your reservation”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler033
Reviews.Content: We'd booked the room two months ago through their own website and received a confirmation e-mail a week before. None of that mattered. They overbooked, didn't have a room for us (but did check in the people behind us), and sent us to a hotel a 20-minute drive out of town. No room service, no indoor pool, tiny room with only one bed and a rollaway for our son that barely fit in the entryway, blocking the bathroom door. We were exhausted and it was awful. Doubletree is probably lovely, but you can't count on them honoring your reservation. Or even treating you well when they bump you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sudha_8
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. Beautiful big room on the 11th floor, free breakfast and evening canapes in the 11th floor private lounge, fresh baked cookies every day and right by the Hazard trolley stop. Join the Hilton Honours club before you go and get upgraded to the 11th floor. Only 15 mins on the trolley to the centre of San Diego. We didn't need a car at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great base hotel”
Reviews.Author: N1cky24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the holiday weekend, we wanted somewhere that was fairly central. Our main concern when booking was that it was clean, easy to get to attractions, and fairly cheap, as the only time we would be spending here was to sleep. Although the hotel was busy and there was a wedding taking place the staff were polite and helpful. The rooms were a good size, and spotlessly clean. Even though we were so close to the freeway there was little noise. The hotel matched our requirements perfectly and I would definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dv9mrsm
Reviews.Content: We were in California on vacation for a week. We spent the first half in San Francisco and the second in San Diego. We really liked this hotel. Their shuttle will come and pick you up from the airport for free(you will have to pay for the shuttle to take you back but it's cheaper than a taxi). The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was nice and clean. It was just me and my husband and we ended up with a room with two double beds. I didn't think that was what we booked through hotels.com but we end up with more space so that was fine. The trolley stop is directly across the street. For most of our trip the ticket machine at the trolley station was not taking dollars but you can buy all day passes at the hotel front desk. We did not rent a car and did not need to. We could get everywhere we wanted to go via the trolley. When we went to Mission Beach, we just transfered to the bus at Old Town. (You can also do that to get to Sea World). I read some post that said the hotel is far from downtown but with the trolley being right there it didn't seem that far. A few stops and you're at GasLamp or Petco. So if you don't mind waiting sometimes for the trolley to come,it is still public transportation, you can stay at this hotel without renting a car. We had a great time and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Best Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Simopel
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a 4 day Get-Away Trip on the Memorial Day Weekend. The staff was outstanding friendly, gave tips and information what to do without even asking, the reception hall is pleasent and bright. The room size is absolutely perfect and has modern interior. The bathroom was small comparing to the rest of the room but still okay. We've got every day new shower gel or body lotion if it was used the day before. They provide even special Facial Soap and a face cloth from Neutrogena, which is a good - not cheap brand. Everything was clean and the hotel was very quiet. (At least the time we stayed there) They have an inside and an outside pool, nice bar and restaurant. The breakfast buffet was comprehensive and fresh. The Location is very central and has a perfect connection to several highways. Easy short trip to Sea World, Downtown, Old Town, Balboa Park etc. It is sourrounded by several huge shopping malls and restaurants. Trolley Station across the street. Parking cost extra but there is alos plenty on street parking available. I would recommend this Hotel to everyone and Yes I would defenetly stay there again. Unfortunately we did not have nice weather at our stay but especially than I was glad to have a comfortable nice clean room.

Reviews.Title: “$14 per day for self-parking!”
Reviews.Author: seadaughter
Reviews.Content: I would describe the hotel a standard hotel with standard amenities. We received warm cookies on arrival but they were way too sweet and did not make up for the sticker shock of $14 per day for self-parking . We are talking about a place outside the heart of San Diego next to the highway ... (And I am used to all kinds of expensive parking ... coming from Manhattan ... The fee just seems unjustifiable for this part of the country/town ...) The room was spacious and looked nice. However, everything felt like it is made of cheap material. Our room on the fourth floor was also quite noisy. The door was not very sound-proof and I heard people coming in and out for much of the late night/early morning. And then there was this out-of-control party in the hotel that led to police blocking off the entrance for a while ... That was beyond the hotel's control, of course. It just did not add up to a good impression ...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: christine182
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the location and positive TripAdvisor reviews, and very glad I did. Because some reviews mentioned freeway noise, I requested the "quiet side" of the hotel, and was happy to receive a room facing away from Highway 163. We were also upgraded to an Executive room with a balcony at no extra charge. The balcony isn't much to scream about since it's just a view of shopping centers and freeways, but my heart belongs to San Diego, so I LOVED it! I stood out there for nearly an hour taking in Mission Valley, the stadium, the trolley... With the window open the freeway noise is there, but once closed, it was barely audible. The room was spacious, clean, and felt new even though the hotel is not . My only complaint was that the bathroom did not have a separate vanity area, so I couldn't do my hair and makeup while my husband showered. Considering these Executives rooms were renovated in the last few years, that surprised me a bit. That and the funky bathroom pocket door that seemed straight out of a hospital room, but hey, everything else about the room was very nice. The staff here is super friendly, gave us warm cookies upon check-in, and was very helpful explaining the Trolley system. We also were not charged for parking, even though their website stated it was $12/day. The Trolley is very convenient, a station right across from the hotel, I recommend taking that downtown rather than hunting for parking in the Gaslamp. If you aren't ultra-sensitive to freeway noise and want a conveniently-located hotel, I definitely recommend the Doubletree at Hazard Center, I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our girls' weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: lucky121721
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the whole experience. Of course there were positives & negatives just like any other hotel, but overall very satisfied! Positives: directly across the street from trolley station (paid $12 for a three day pass that got us unltd trolley & bus and we went all over), located in a nice quiet area, incredibly friendly and helpful staff (really made you feel like they cared about you & we felt very safe traveling; as a group of girls that meant a lot), great breakfast and evening reception for executive level guests (totally worth springing for), spacious room, very comfortable beds, free shuttle pick-up from airport, free wireless internet Negatives: not enough outlets in the bathroom/coffee counter area (had to use an extension cord), no hot water the first day (but was fixed quickly enough when we called the desk), cost is $10 to ride shuttle back to airport (cheaper if there are 4 to split a cab--and they actually got us a towncar for the same price), no fan in the bathroom, not very many towels/ no towel hooks/rack (we hung ours in the closet but housekeeping came quickly when called for more) The negatives are really pretty trifling. We had a great time & plan on going back! FYI: trolley only runs to about 12:45a so if you're out later a cab will cost you about $20-25 from Gaslamp Quarter or Pacific Beach (we loved PB for the college-age low-cover charge Typhoon bar & the awesome Thai restaurant on Garnet--ask to sit on the floor)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 5 Days for Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mkgice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We wanted to stay at a nice hotel with a few amenities like a spa, restaurant, etc. We arrived early so were not upset when our room wasn't ready. They gave us warm cookies and we waited in the lobby. The room was pretty standard but very clean and professional. The bed was huge and very comfortable with tons of pillows. The hotel offers room service, and for breakfast all you have to do is fill out a checklist of what you want and hang it on the door--very handy and totally delicious! The spa--as far as we could tell--was a small room near the indoor pool. We both got wonderful massages for a very reasonable price. The outdoor pool is much better than the hotel's website photos show. It is modern and minimalist and they have bonfires at night.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality but Freeway Facing Room was Noisy”
Reviews.Author: OregonTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights stay while touring USD with our college bound daughter. I prefer to stay at four star hotels where available. After much web searching, reading reviews, etc, I decided not to stay downtown (not in the partying stage of life now!) due to noise and bars. For me all areas of San Diego are a short drive so I was not limited on where in San Diego to stay. All of the upper end hotels were a similar price range unless you jump to the five star level so the costs were similar. Most charge for parking. This Double Tree had $12/day posted on their garage ($15 for valet parking) but we were not charged anything. The staff was very professional and accommodating: we arrived early and a room was not reay but they offered us a temporary room until ours was available. We declined since we were going right out and they gladly tagged and held our carry on bags for us. We were told our room would be prepared next and they called us within an hour and advised us that our room was ready - this was at 11am! My only objection was the freeway was right outside our window and the howling car hum kept me up at night. However be advised that we live on a country road where it is drop dead silent, so we are probably more sensitive to this factor than most. We would most definitely stay at this hotel again if our daugher chooses USD for her undergrad college. I have not stayed at a Double Tree Hotel prior to this visit but I was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously?”
Reviews.Author: toves
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the positive reviews on this property, I was very excited to stay here. My husband was attending a conference downtown and I was working out of our La Jolla office. When I called the hotel to confirm the location, they assured me that they were a 10 minute trolley ride to the convention center. How crazy of me to believe them?
