When my husband tried to take the trolley to the convention the first day, he was told that it was a 45 minute ride and u had to transfer lines!! Are you kidding me? We wound up staying for 2 night and then moved to a gorgeous Hyatt in La Jolla so I could walk to the office and he could drive to the convention. Otherwise, the hotel property is ok. The fitness center is great and that is about it. The room was ok. Of course I found hairs in the shower which is always lovely. The bed was comfortable, but the amenities were subpar. I am sorry, but warm cookies do not make up for the lack of service and attention to detail at this property. I would more than likely not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Expected a lot more for my money”
Reviews.Author: UkZob
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable and I cannot fault the helpfulness of the staff. However I had stayed the previous week at the OMNI hotel in LA and for the 200 pounds per week more that I paid I was expecting a lot more for my money. The lobby is nicely decorated but i found the room a bit dark and the bathroom did not have a separate shower cubicle. The rooms seemed as if they wanted updating. I just could not put my finger on it. Also I think the hotel washes the carpets regularly and there is sometimes a smell of wet dog in the mornings. However the valet parking is reasonably priced and ther is a tram stop just outside the hotel which is great for getting down town and to the malls. A couple of minor complaints: Bar Prices expensive Breakfast prices expensive And only 1 washing machine and 1 dryer for the whole hotel!!!!! what's that about? Overall an OK hotel and I would recommend it to someone who wishes to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: berbicianmaryland
Reviews.Content: Myself husband and 16yr old son stayed at the Double tree Hotel in Misson Valley San Diego for Spring Break. From the time I checked in at the front desk the staff was extremely helpful accomodating and very friendly. Our room was not ready and we were promptly called when it was. The service was top-notch. Everytime I called for something to be brought to the room it was very prompt and I always received a call to find out if what I asked for was delivered. I would highly recommend this hotel and we defenitely will return to San Diego and stay here. KUDOS TO THE STAFF AT THIS DOUBLE TREE EXCELLENT SERVICE !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: neilwilson44
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the Doubletree and was in no way disappointed. The room good and the bed extremely comfortable. The bathroom like the rest of the room was clean and spacious. The room had a small balcony and it was nice to wake up in a morning and step out as the sun was coming up, while drinking that first coffee of the day. The hotel is in an excellent location, and downtown San Diego can easily be reached by car or by using the excellent tram system. The staff were very friendly and professional and did an all round good job.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Accommodating Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExactingTraveller
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed at the Marriot in the same neighborhood and was not overly impressed with the service or the room. I selected the Doubletree for this visit based on reviews from other members. Except for the bathroom, which I think was cramped and poorly done with a sliding door, I found the room to be very nice. What impressed me most about this hotel was the service. From check-in all the way through checkout I found everyone in the hotel to be very friendly and accommodating. The most surprising thing was the hotel's response when I asked for a late checkout time the day of my departure. I almost fell over when the person at the front desk didn't hesitate and said "no problem" and quickly typed my requested departure time into the computer. In all of the hotels I have stayed, including the expensive, 5 star hotels, I have always had a negative response when asking for some accommodation on departure time. I will return to this hotel again and again (I have a daughter attending SDSU). The only reason I didn't give this hotel an "excellent" rating was the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jcatral14
Reviews.Content: I needed a nice clean hotel and this place delivered beyond what was expected. I would def go back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great in all aspects, if you can stand the traffic noice”
Reviews.Author: Panboy
Reviews.Content: Great service, clean and comfortable rooms, conveniently close to the mall and tram stop. All is fine except from at least two heavily trafficed interstates in the near proximity causing a lot of noice. If you don't mind that, there is nothing that can dissapoint you here. Also mind that there is no way you walk from here to the city, you have to bring car or take the tram. But I believe that is reflected in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: td507
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to the executive floor upon check in, I believe everybody was. I had a vehicle , but had I not there is a trolley directly across from the hotel. The bed was very comfortable with nightly turn down service and a cookie. The restaurant Windows has excellent fries, and has a pleasant atmosphere with notable employees. The outside pool was heated, the exercise room was well equipped. There is a grocery store within walking distance and many quick eat places in the area. They had a holiday buffet with a good selection, I did not participate so I can not comment on the food quality. but it was busy on Christmas day. Enjoy the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location (w/ Car)”
Reviews.Author: imazz
Reviews.Content: Great location! Beside the one of the biggest and busiest mall in San Diego. Glad that hotel was nearby to catch a nap. You can spend 2 full days walking the other nearby outdoor malls. All the major stores you are looking for. Hotel itself is great. very comfortable and large rooms. Only peev is that there isn't wi-fi in the rooms. But there is free wi-fi in the lobby and the business centre has free internet access as well.

Reviews.Title: “GReaT HOTEL!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chivoloco1
Reviews.Content: great location, great hotel, friendly employees. next time in san diego i would stay again. great chocolate cookies. if somebody need and advice, contact. me, i speak spanish

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Access to Transportation”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom1122
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree to attend a football game at Qualcomm. We we're in San Diego for two nights and never moved the car! The trolley is just too convenient. With a trolley stop literally right outside the hotel door, we used the trolley to get to the Harbor area, Old Town, the football game and a movie. The staff at the hotel was friendly and professional. Our room was spacious, well maintained and the bed was comfortable. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All this and cookies too?!”
Reviews.Author: pennygreen
Reviews.Content: Great stay! Wonderful staff and great facilities! The room was huge and comfortable! We had the Thanksgiving Day buffett in the lobby cafe and it was amazing! Great food!! And they gave us warm, fresh cookies! The parking was a bit expensive, but we managed to find free parking on the street just in front of the hotel. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of thebest places I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: jaykl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Doubletree Nov 07, Booked through Hotwire and couldn't have been happier. Very clean Hotel, Trolley stops right there. They sell day trolley passes at the front desk for $5. Fresh cookies on check in, excellent. The people are so friendly, said hi to us by name whenever we came or went. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December 2006, and we came back for another stay over Thanksgiving weekend 2007. If anything, it has improved. The quality of the staff is excellent. The people at the front desk, the bell stand and the valet parking seemed truly interested in our being happy, not just in doing their job. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: carlv247
Reviews.Content: Booked a reward stay on the HHonors program after reading all the glowing reviews about this Doubletree and we were not disappointed. Very convenient for Balboa Park, Sea World and for experiencing a little bit of suburbia. The hotel staff is very pleasant and helpful, the rooms are nice (though obviously upgraded from what could have been a low end Ramada or motel) and the beds comfortable. Overall maintenance of the elevators could have been better, but that was really the only sore point. Nearby are all your conveniences if you're on a business trip: two supermarkets, Jamba Juice, Starbucks, post office, several restaurants (though we drove into the city for dinner at the fabulous Bertrand at Mister A's) etc. Seaworld is closeby, and so are many other attractions. Parking is not a problem here. OK, you don't get a San Diego Bay view, but everything else is here so you save money by skipping the view. The manager's reception on the executive level and breakfast in the morning are very well done and attended by a very helpful and friendly hostess who will give you directions, tips for what to do in the city and more. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. The location is great as there is a trolley stop right across the street from the hotel. There are also lots of dining options close to the hotel ( Prego, Applebees, Joe's crab Shack etc) or it is really easy on the trolley to get to downtown or Old Town. We had an executive room on the 10th floor which was really comfortable, large, had an alarm clock which you could plug your Ipod into and a super balcony. Each night we had warm cookies delivered to our rooms which is a lovely touch. The service from all hotel staff was great and the breakfast in the mornings which is free of charge if you're in an exec level room, is excellent. In the evening you can sit outdoors by the fire pits with a drink or sit in the whirlpool. There is an indoor and outdoor pool open until 10pm and a shop in the hotel which also servesStarbucks coffee. Definite place to stay in San Diego and so easy to get into downtown or Old Town in the day or evening.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Clean, Convenient to restaurants but not to Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: vacation joie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here October 4-6 for a conference that was in the hotel. TRANSPORTATION The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle from the airport to the hotel. I was told to call the front desk upon arrival to the airport since it takes about 15-30 minutes for the shuttle to arrive. Since the hotel was sold out (due to the conference) the shuttle was very slow. I ended up waiting for an hour for the shuttle. There were others who were waiting but were given a voucher to be used on a taxi to get to the hotel. The trolley stop is about half a block across the street from the hotel. We went to the Gaslamp district (a must see in the evening! Most stores are open til 8pm) for dinner. We had to transfer twice and thankfully had other tourists with us who knew how to get there....otherwise, it might save you the hassle of transfers by taking a taxi. Roundtrip trolley ride cost us each $5. The trolleys only run every half hour in the evenings, so it ended up taking us about 1.5 hours to get back to the hotel (which should normally take about 30 minutes!) Looking back at it, if we had more than 2 people, taking a taxi might've been more time/cost effective. CHECK IN Check in was easy and went smoothly. You get a warm chocolate chip cookie (that was DELICIOUS!!) at the front desk. (you can get them anytime and as many as you'd like). I was staying with a roommate who had put both of our names on the room so that I could check in without her being there. Someone else was checking in the same time I was and didn't do this...she had to contact the roommate and it took her a while to get a hold of her. So be sure to have all names on the room if you're checking in separately. AMMENITIES The gym was recently remodeled and VERY NICE! The equipment was very high quality (precor) and each of the eliptical machines, stationary bicycles and treadmills had their own individual tvs. There's also a large flat screen tv. There's exercise balls, stretchy cords, medicine balls and lots of free weights as well as a weight machine. There's benches and a crunch helper machine. This was the best-stocked gym that I've ever seen in a hotel. The pool and hot tub looked nice although I didn't go in. There's 2 outdoor fire pits that are lit in the evenings. These were nice to sit by (nice furniture too) as the evenings are pretty balmy. Our conference used the large ballroom and most of the individual rooms. The large ballroom was beautiful and very bright. The individual rooms were a little small for some of the workshops and slightly claustraphobic-feeling as there's not windows. The hotel itself was very nice and clean. Service was pretty helpful and friendly overall. FOOD There's a bar and lounge area. My roommate ate their pizza at the bar and she said it was about $9 for a personal vegetarian pizza that tasted pretty fresh. There's also a restaurant-- it looked like they have an omelet bar on weekends. We didn't eat here since we had conference food. The conference food was okay.....nothing to write home about. But I did notice staff replenishing food very quickly. Service was very good and attentive. The hotel is very conveniently located near several restaurants within walking distance. If you walk up the stairs in the lobby, you'll find a little strip mall-like series of shops. There's an educators store, a sports bar, applebees (i think), barne's and noble and some other stores. There's also a movie theater. There's a small cafe that's open for breakfast and lunch. Metrazzano cafe? They have good wraps and sandwiches and some interesting iced teas. Decently priced for $5-6 sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: eek_19
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The room was comfortable and very quiet. We got cookies on checkin, as well as the following night just because we were in the elevator with the staff member with a cart full of them. The location is very convenient - right by the trolley stop, so we could easily get anywhere on the route, without having to stay right downtown and deal with the noise. Comfortable beds, free internet terminals, helpful staff, a free shuttle from the airport - an all around nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel with Good Service but beware the traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: runningpie
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel in terms of service and amenities are all deservedly high. We were satisfied with all of that - in fact the service was so good that the manager comped our room! Why? Because my wife could not sleep due to the traffic noise. Although this hotel is very conveniently located as everyone says - a 10 minute drive to seaworld without bothering to get on a freeway for example - it is surrounded by busy roads and right next to a shopping center. It is not in any of the pretty coastal areas you might be considering. I guess you have to weigh your options. This property - and Doubletree in general - offers superior service and comfort, but this location is not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MonsterPl
Reviews.Content: Great location, trolley station across the street, helpful and very nice staff (thank you Martin!), comfortable and clean rooms, nice pool, delicious food and...cookies that you get when you check-in. I recommend it to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DallasTraveler06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at this hotel during the ComicCon - the largest comic book (and more) convention in the world. Therefore, I'm sure we paid alot more than the hotel normally charges. But I was pleased with our room, which was just fine. We did pay to be on the executive floor, whereas our friends didn't. The rooms were practically identical, with the only exception being that we had a plant in our room. And our bathroom was much smaller, which didn't make sense to me. The upstairs breakfast / hospitality area was included with our executive-level (and more expensive) room. This was the first time we paid a higher price for the executive floor, so we made a point to check out the breakfast. It was OK, but the space was warm and cramped. It reminded me of most hotels in Europe, as far as being very cramped in space and somewhat intimate with all of your fellow guests. The main hostess was militant and overbearing. And to our horror (ha ha), forced some other guests to hug her when they said that they were leaving that day. We then took our leave rather quickly and went down for breakfast in the main restaurant. I would not pay for executive level rooms again. But the hotel itself was fine and the location was great, and was right across the street from the Trolley Stop, which is a GREAT convenience. We did get stuck with the parking fee, but this is normal for this area. I would definitely stay here again, provided that it wasn't quite so expensive, and it wasn't during the Comic Con!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Great Area”
Reviews.Author: KrissyH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in August. We loved being able to catch the trolley from across the street. $5.00 for all day. It took us to PETCO Park, the Gaslamp District and Old Town. The staff were great. They gave us another cookie on our second night. Because we belong to Hilton Honors, I asked for a complementary breakfast voucher and received a free breakfast w/drink for my husband and myself. A savings of $30.00! There is a small shopping center adjacent to the hotel and the trolley will take you to Mission Valley and Fashion Valley Malls. Easy access to all major (163, 5, 15, 8) freeways. We will definately stay here again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kaywinnit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at a nearby hotel, and I am so thankful I got a room here. The hotel was convenient to grocery stores, restaurants, a movie theatre, and the trolley. Shopping was only one trolley stop away. The room was lovely, and the housekeeping staff did a great job all week. The pocket door for the bathroom is a bit weird, though. The fitness room and pools were nice. I had a breakfast buffet included in my rate, and it was delicious. My only disappointment is they changed the breakfast two days before I checked out and it went from an excellent buffet to eggs and sausage or bacon served at the table. Overall, it was a great place to call home for a week with comfy beds, friendly staff, and a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Awaits at this Doubletree Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ten78cop
Reviews.Content: All the reviews about this hotel are true. Service is great. After our first night of sleeping on perhaps the worst hotel mattress ever (serious center sag) I complained to the front desk. By 2pm a new mattress was put in the room! Room is good sized. Bathroom lay out is poor. Not enough counter space. Toilet is under some of the narrow counter so keep the lid closed if you don't want to loose things! Shower water pressure is outstanding. Everything about the room was clean. The room was non-smoking but there was still a slight odor of smoke when you first walked in. The hotel has smoking floors every other floor. Did not use the restaurants/bar at hotel. Pool areas and gym are nice. The location of this hotel is great. Across the street is the trolley which can put you almost anywhere you need to go. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Fashion Valley Mall one trolley stop away or a 5 minute commute by car for even more choices. Posted sign said $12 per day parking fee. During check in I was not asked if I had a car to park (even though I did). Upon check out I was not charged any parking fee. I was glad about that considering the price I paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it...”
Reviews.Author: TobyBo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 10 nights and didn't want to leave. We were in glorious Southern California on our honeymoon, after getting married in Vegas. Location was perfect, fantastic transport links to all attractions. Food was very nice and the bar staff were very accommodating to all our requests. Great leisure facilities, just what you need to burn away all those choc chip cookies. The whole team really looked after us, well actually spoiled us. I would highly recommend this hotel for any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Double tree - San Diego Hazard Center”
Reviews.Author: midottie
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was at the Hazard Center. Beautiful rooms, beds, pool -- fire pits that are lit everynight near the pool, cocktail area. We did not have a car, and used the public transportation Trolley, and bus all weekend, and easily got from this hotel to Old Town for great Mexican atmosphere, , the Harbor for the Harbor tour and to visit the USS Midway floating museum, Gaslamp area, San Ysidro/Tijuana border ( I wanted to see the border-town), and a bus that traversed the whole Island of Cornado, and let us off by the beautiful del Coronado hotel. Total transportation costs for 2 days: $18.00 for 2 people!! We chose to take a cab to the airport, but a bus would have gotten us there too. From this hotels 2nd floor, you are just steps from Kinkos, Trophy sports restaurant, Joe's Crab shack, and Applebees., Starbucks, etc. and We got a wonderful buy on Hotwire to boot! My husband really enjoyed seeing all the Navy vessels in the harbor, the training center for the Navy Seals, etc. This is one great town. Got to see Petco park, and three more stopsy past our hotel would have gotten us to Qualcomm Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Exeptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Luckymommy
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (including kids aged 9 and 4) had a delightful stay at this hotel. We found the customer service to be exemplary! We were always addressed by our names, and every encounter we had with the staff involved them bending over backwards to make our stay pleasant. For example, we had requested extra bath towels from housekeeping one evening. Not only were the towels promptly delivered, we also received a call from the front desk to make sure the towels had arrived and to make sure we were satisfied. This happened more than once, as we made various basic requests. The room was a good size and comfortably accommodated our family. The hotel itself is lovely--clean and well-maintained. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again. I consider myself to be fairly picky, and the Doubletree Mission Valley did not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaCJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from another trip to San Diego. We found the Doubletree on Hotwire and couldn't resist the price. I would have paid 5 times as much for such a great hotel. The staff was freindly and courteous like I have never seen before, the room was spacious enough and very clean, the beds were super comfortable. Parking did cost $12.00, but we're talking about covered parking in a garage under the hotel not out on the street. You don't even need a car here, there is a trolley station right across the street and an all day pass cosy only $5.00 per person, try finding gas that cheap! We had only one problem, a dog left alone in a room across the hall while the owners went out was barking, a call to the front desk sent security right away and the problem was resolved in less than 5 minutes. The room was very quiet, you might want to ask for one on the side away from the freeway. We were on the side near the trolley tracks and could barely hear it when they came by. We stay in San Diego a lot and usually wind up at a different hotel each time because we are looking for the best deal, however, I think in the future we will just start looking right here for our hotel everytime. I give this place 5 stars, 6 if you'll let me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: javisq
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here quite a few times and there is good reason for it. This is a great hotel for the price. Everything is up to date and the rooms are good sized. The bathroom is a fine size, not huge, but it does use a pocket door which does not lock. There is plenty of parking, but it does cost $12 a night which seems a bit much. The hotel is right across from a trolley stop and so it is easy to get around. It also has easy access to the 8 freeway and the 163. There is a little road noise, but it is not very loud at all. Nice pools (yes, there are two).

Reviews.Title: “very clean”
Reviews.Author: maris05
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and spacious, beds were very comfortable, bathroom excelent. Negative points: althought my room was not at the freeway side, I had a lot of constant noise from some "machine" outside the hotel. No fridge in the room. The breakfast was not worth the value. In general, the employees at the front desk were nice, except the lady at my check in, very rude. The location in not great for those who donÂ´t have a car. Far from downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NODAK1979
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Hotwire, and got it for 85 dollars...which was a steal. I really don't have any complaints about the hotel....the room was ample, check-in was a breeze, and it's in a great location to just about everything you'd want to see. Parking was 12 dollars, but it's more at comparable hotels, so you really can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: CaKazmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed over May 12th. I did have to pay for parking $12, because at registration they asked me if I drove. I did use the pools and gym, and they were adequate. I felt the hotel was very safe, clean and close to everything I needed. Being with just my daughter, these issues were important. The beds are great. My biggest complaint would be the bathroom...it was too small. Plus it had a sliding door, that could barely close. Not what I expected for $180 a night. And my view was of a rooftop! Not the best considering you are in San Dieog. But, I would probably stay again, if it was just me and my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Angelfan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for just over $100, for a weekend! Most comfortable beds ever, and great location if you need public transportation. Trolley station is literally right next door. Parking was free, even though sign said $12 a night, and unlike others, I had no problem with sound from the freeway. Great stay, and I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bunky67
Reviews.Content: Boy I am shocked this hotel hasn't gotten better reviews of 5! We were supposed to move to another hotel after a few days as we were in San Diego with my husband on business. The weekend was supposed to be spent at the Embassy Suites Downtown (see my review of it! YIKES!) but after seeing what it was like we came right back to the Doubletree Mission Valley! We were so happy to be there! My husband is a rewards member and we stayed on the 11th floor and had our bfasts included! It was wonderful! Lea at the executive level lounge serves a great bfast! And was so nice! All the staff at this hotel went above and beyond for us! The ONLY complaint I have is that, as stated in a earlier review there is street noise. This would be something doubletree should fix in the future. They remodel every 2 yrs we were told. So hopefully they will sound proof a bit better. But the decor and comfy beds were wonderful! I have no complaints. This hotel was very very clean! And there are 2 pools for the kids and a nice hot tub! There are several restaurants nearby, applebees, Trophys (great food), asian food and italian restaurant Prego, also a Quiznos sub place....very nicely situated with all walking distance! OH also there is a food 4 less walking distance from the hotel too! The mall is just the next trolley stop from the hotel and the trolley stops across the street from the hotel. The hotel was not overrun with people and was very nice and quiet most of the time! The walls are not very well insulated I don't think....we did have a issue one night hearing our neighbors on the other side making a bit too much noise for our kids ears! But the hotel took care of that quickly. It was nice! We had a great trip! And if we go to San Diego again we will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Ick”
Reviews.Author: DawnNoelm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my 10 year old daughter. We were in town for a cheer competition at San Diego State. I would NOT recommend this hotel. The rooms greatly need a re-do as do the hallways. Our room smelled like a dog - literally. The noise from the freeway kept us both awake.

Reviews.Title: “Mall hotel. Average and not cheap.”
Reviews.Author: sac-eats
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel three times for business and each stay gets a little worse. The "neighborhood" is basically a large big box retailer center, which comes in handy if you forget to bring a belt, but does not really give you much of a taste of beautiful San Diego. The hotel staff was really friendly and helpful, and I cannot fault them, but there are a few complaints. Although the hotel has a nice indoor pool, the rest of the workout facility is outdated and some of the equipment was out of order. Also, the traffic noise, not just from the freeway but also from the trolley, was readily apparent whenever I went to sleep. That, and the towels were abrasive enough to rub the skin off a porcupine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but Traffic Noise”
Reviews.Author: TreschichommeKC
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the other reviewers--this is a fine hotel in most respects. Its located next to a shopping area which includes a Barnes and Noble and a few restaurants, though Mission Valley is hardly a culinary delight in general. I love the Intermezzo cafe just down the mall, a very easy stroll; its an independent coffee house which now has to compete with the usually intrusive Starbucks next door. As for the facilities, they are generally above average. The workout room is not cramped as in many hotels and the bar and restaurant are nice enough, though I didn't patronize them. The staff is helpful and friendly. My only complaint is that I asked for a quiet room and was assured my room was on the "quiet side" of the hotel. Actually it faced Friars Road and/or Interstate 8 and it almost sounded as if the windows were open! I kept checking to make sure that they weren't, and they were indeed closed. I would have been extremely annoyed by this had I not paid a relatively low government rate. It is incomprehensible to me that a hotel as otherwise new and beautiful as this one cannot be built to muffle outdoor noise! Other than this my stay was quite enjoyable, particularly for Mission Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Another fine doubletree property”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is available cheap on Priceline (consistently $60 or even less). Its close to restaurants and grocery stores, parking is charged for but there is street parking available also.... The fitness room is great, the pool is tremendous, beds comfy, five stars all around!!! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the bill. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: orchidboy
Reviews.Content: Based upon the reviews on tripadvisor we bookd two nights over x-mas. parking was a snap [i was charged for it]. check-in was a brezze and the hot cookies a nice touch. room was fine and the bed was comfy. the only negative was getting on the internet in our room. i had to go to the lobby. they took it off the bill. the food was pretty good for a hotel. if you really want a great meal check out Hash House A-go-go. it is a five minute drive. food is great, only negative is the size of the portions -- they are too big. first meal i can recall not finishing. the zoo and wild animal park are easy to get to from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Doubletree Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: Daylami
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from 25 November. We went down to San Diego after having spent four nights at the Doubletree Guest Suites in Santa Monica. The hotel in Santa Monica was great, so we were looking forward to staying in this hotel, and we were not disappointed. We had booked an executive room (these are on floors10 and 11 and you need your key card to access these floors from the lift). Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable. The Doubletree beds are VERY comfortable. The bathroom has complimentary toiletries. Guests in executive rooms get complimentary continental breakfast on the 11th floor, which includes choice of juice, cereals, toast, bagels, boiled eggs, fresh fruit, pastries, cakes, tea and coffee. The hotel is conveniently located right by a trolley stop. A trip into downtown San Diego takes about 30 minutes. The Fashion Valley mall is one stop away on the trolley. We bought a three day pass for the trolley (which can also be used on buses) which was great value. We were in San Diego to go to the Charger vs. Raiders football game and the trolley goes from outside the hotel right to the stadium in only 10 minutes or so. We had a great stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: MindyPo
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at the Doubletree. It was clean, the beds were comfortable, the staff friendly, parking is FREE (it's not $12 a day). I loved the firepits by the pool at night. My only concern was the noise! It is right by the freeway, so it's quite loud. I slept fine because I am a heavy sleeper, but beware if you're a light sleeper...

Reviews.Title: “Run Far and Run Fast!”
Reviews.Author: cabogolf19
Reviews.Content: This place is bad, bad, bad. It is extremely overpriced for what you get. I had an 8th floor room facing Interstate 8. Good luck getting any sleep. Shame on you Doubletree, how can you justify charging top dollar for a room on the freeway side? You should provide earplugs for guests that are subjected to this horrendous noise. In addition, apparently their restaurant never got the word that there was an issue with serving fresh spinach. I completely lost my desire to finish my meal. When this was pointed out to the server, the cost of the meal was removed from my bill. The service in the bar was extremely poor. There is no other choice for dinner. You may want to eat elsewhere or face going hungry. Overall this experience doesnâ€™t even deserve to rate below average. If you donâ€™t need to stay here donâ€™t. A host of other better and less expensive lodging choices abound in San Diego. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. I will next time.

Reviews.Title: “liked the doubletree”
Reviews.Author: anon03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while attending a business conference at the hotel. Our 11th floor room was very spacious with comfortable beds and high quality linens. The room seemed to be well soundproofed, which is very important to us. We are very picky about not hearing noise from neighboring rooms. Housekeeping was excellent. We had a bit of traffic noise, though only a very minor inconvenience. but our room faced the pool --I think rooms facing the numerous freeways around the hotel might have more of a traffic noise problem. The only problem we had was the inescapable piped-in music at both pools and the hot tub, and some rowdy teenagers who rudely interrupted my lap swimming. Otherwise, we had a great experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern and super location”
Reviews.Author: pradancer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here August 27th. I am already booking reservations to come back in November for Thanksgiving Shopping!!!! "Clint" at the Front desk was excellent! It was CLEAN!!!! The grounds were Clean and modern. The Entry and valet area did not have concrete, but granite sidewalks, automatic doors, and everything you would expect from a luxury hotel. Some areas of the hotel reminded me of the Ritz Carlton. It was just that clean, well kept and impressive. The Bed was big and super comfortable. The room was large and spacious! The Swimming pools were super fun. The hot tub was the smallest I have ever seen-but hey, it is great the hotel has a large indoor pool. The Fitness room was Clean and large. There is an outdoor fireplace at night. The shopping area is FANTASTIC! The hotel is surrounded by upscale malls, shopping centers and every store and food court you can imagine. There is a Neiman and Saks! The beach is a nine minute drive. The hotel is not too far from Sea World, but you of course, you need a car. Only complaints: (1) Not enough Cable channels. No Disney channel for our kids. (2) The hot cookies have nuts and oats inside. (3) The old man at the concierge must be a volunteer. He was old and impatient and unprofessional. No more Marriott for me, I got hooked at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Had a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: contactme99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Jul 29-30. Liked the hotel, our room, and the hotel's location (in a shopping area with plenty of restaurants -- loved Joe's Crabs!). Parking was free. Had a nice stay. At $188/night, the hotel was certainly overpriced, though ($99-$129 would be reasonable for this hotel if chains like the Travelodge or Comfort Inn charge between $69 and $89).

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: Aussie08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree for three nights at the end of July. We called ahead the day before to tell them we would be a late check in due to late flights. On arrival we were told there was no room for us and the hotel was fully booked. As soon as my husband produced proof of the phone call a room was miraculously found. We are still not sure if it was a scam or not. The room itself was adequate with the exception of there being no fridge. Unlike Alaska, San diego is a warm climate and we couldn't believe there was no fridge. There is also no safe. Housekeeping was bearly average with occasionally hair left behind in the bathroom. We would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: billberry
Reviews.Content: Me and the Mrs stayed there July 17, 18 and enjoyed the place alot. The rooms were nice and clean, the people staff was super friendly and happy to tell us all about SD. At night by the pools they light fires in a lave pit and folks come down and chat over a few cold ones and have something to eat as well. Parking was 12 bucks a night like they say even if the gate is up at the parking garage but everything is so close as far as food goes so it was all good. We bid 75 bucks on price line and that was a great rate since most of the rooms were going for 200+.
